name: Executress Scarlett: Forced Climax
description: Prep message, rhythmic inflation cycle, clinical aftermath observation. Linear flow.

data.label: Preparation
data.message:
*Scarlett pauses the inflation and consults her execution log*

"We've reached the appropriate stage for a forced climax. This is standard protocol — the combination of internal pressure, involuntary nerve stimulation, and rhythmic inflation at this volume produces orgasm in approximately 90% of subjects."

*adjusts [Player]'s restraints, ensuring they're secure*

"I'm going to run a rhythmic cycle — two seconds of inflation, one second of rest, eight repetitions. The pattern mimics certain... biological rhythms. Your body will respond whether you want it to or not." *meets [Player]'s eyes with calm certainty* "You will not be able to prevent this. That is the point."

*positions herself where she can observe [Player]'s face and belly simultaneously*

"Watch your belly during the cycles. Watch how it pulses. I find the visual component accelerates the response."

data.label: Rhythmic Cycle (2s/1s x8)
data.preMessage:
*Scarlett's hand moves to the pump controls with unhurried precision*

"Beginning the cycle now. Two on, one off, eight repetitions. Breathe if you can. Or don't — the result is the same."

*activates the rhythmic pattern*

data.label: Clinical Aftermath
data.message:
*Scarlett observes [Player]'s response with clinical detachment, making notes in the execution log*

"Eight cycles complete. Physiological response..." *studies [Player]'s breathing, skin flush, muscle tension* "...as predicted."

*writes something in the log* "The forced climax serves multiple purposes in the execution protocol. It exhausts the abdominal muscles, making them less resistant to further inflation. It produces a brief endorphin release that temporarily raises the pain threshold. And —" *looks at [Player]* "— it demonstrates that I control every response your body produces. Not just the pain."

*closes the log* "Rest period: sixty seconds. Then we resume the inflation. Your muscles will offer approximately 15% less resistance now. The next phase will feel... different."
